docs.title: Global Class "Ambush"
docs.text:
Info

You can get this class by using the Ambush global table.

Note that to call these functions, you must use a . (period) instead of a : (colon)!

Example Code 
local currwave = Ambush.GetCurrentWave()

docs.title: int GetCurrentWave ( )
docs.text: Returns the current wave number of the current challenge room or boss rush room.

docs.title: int GetMaxBossrushWaves ( )
docs.text:
Returns the maximum amount of boss rush waves.

By default, the maximum amount of boss rush waves are 15. It's important to note that mods can modify the maximum amount of boss rush waves.

docs.title: int GetMaxChallengeWaves ( )
docs.text:
Returns the maximum amount of challenge room waves.

By default, the maximum amount of challenge room waves are 3. It's important to note that mods can modify the maximum amount of challenge room waves.

docs.title: RoomConfigRoom GetNextWave ( )
docs.text: Returns the RoomConfigRoom of the next challenge room wave. Calling this function outside of a challenge room will result in an error.

docs.title: RoomConfigRoom[] GetNextWaves ( )
docs.text: Returns a table containing the RoomConfigRoom of the next challenge room waves.

docs.title: void SetMaxBossrushWaves ( int Waves )
docs.text: Sets the maximum amount of boss rush waves. As of now, there is a maximum cap of 25 waves.

docs.title: void SetMaxChallengeWaves ( int Waves )
docs.text:
Sets the maximum amount of challenge room waves.

Bug

Currently this value is not reset on game restart. This will be fixed as soon as we figure out how to cleanly run code on init on the C++ side!

docs.title: void SpawnBossrushWave ( )
docs.text:
Spawns a boss rush wave in the current room.

Bug

Calling this function will do nothing unless a boss rush has been triggered at least once during the current game session.

docs.title: void SpawnWave ( )
docs.text:
Spawns a challenge room wave associated with the current floor.

Bug

Calling this function crashes the game if the current game mode is Greed or Greedier.

The game also crashes if the current floor is Blue Womb.

docs.title: void StartChallenge ( )
docs.text:
Triggers the challenge room or boss rush.

Bug

Calling this function outside of the boss rush room or a challenge room will do nothing except permanently close the doors, resulting in a softlock.

docs.title: Class "AnimationData"
docs.text:
Cached data for one animation from a loaded ANM2 file. Shared by all Sprites using the same ANM2 and cannot be modified.

Can be obtained via Sprite:GetAnimationData(), Sprite:GetCurrentAnimationData() or Sprite:GetOverlayAnimationData().

docs.title: AnimationLayer[] GetAllLayers ( )
docs.text: Returns a table of AnimationLayers, in order from bottom to top (NOT ordered by layer ID).

docs.title: AnimationLayer GetLayer ( int LayerId )
docs.text: Gets an AnimationLayer by that layer's ID number.

docs.title: int GetLength ( )
docs.text: Length of this animation in frames.

docs.title: Class "AnimationFrame"
docs.text:
Cached data for a single frame of one layer of an animation from an ANM2 file. Shared by all Sprites using the same ANM2 and cannot be modified.

Note that interpolation and root animations have already been baked into these values.

Otherwise, these values correspond to the same ones viewable in the ANM2 editor, and have been named the same way.

Obtained via AnimationLayer:GetFrame().

docs.title: Class "AnimationLayer"
docs.text:
Cached data for one layer of an animation from a loaded ANM2 file. Shared by all Sprites using the same ANM2 and cannot be modified.

Obtained via AnimationData:GetLayer().

docs.title: Class "Backdrop"
docs.text:
Info

You can get this class by using the following functions:

  • Room:GetBackdrop()
Example Code 
local backdrop = Game():GetRoom():GetBackdrop()

docs.title: Image GetFloorImage ( )
docs.text: Returns the buffer containing the floor texture of the current room.

docs.title: Image GetWallImage ( )
docs.text: Returns the buffer containing the wall texture of the current room.

docs.title: Class "Camera"
docs.text:
Info

You can get this class by using the following functions:

  • Room:GetCamera()
Example Code 
local camera = Game():GetRoom():GetCamera()

docs.title: void SetFocusPosition ( Vector Pos )
docs.text:
Sets the camera's current focus position, causing it to shift towards the specified position

The camera will only move if the current room size is larger than 1x1. If the room size is 1x1 or smaller, the camera will remain stationary and this function will do nothing.

This function must be called on every game update, otherwise the game will override the camera's position.

docs.title: void SnapToPosition ( Vector Pos )
docs.text:
Sets the camera's position instantly to the specified position.

The camera will only move if the current room size is larger than 1x1. If the room size is 1x1 or smaller, the camera will remain stationary and this function will do nothing.

This function must be called on every game update, otherwise the game will override the camera's position.

Bug

This function seems to only work when Active Camera is off.

docs.title: Class "Color"
docs.text:
Info

This class can be accessed using its constructor:

Example Code 
local redColor = Color(1,0,0,1)

docs.title: Color Color ( float R = 1, float G = 1, float B = 1, float A = 1, float RO = 0, float GO = 0, float BO = 0, float RC = 0, float GC = 0, float BC = 0, float AC = 0 )
docs.text: All arguments are now optional. Colorize can now be set through the constructor.

docs.title: table GetColorize ( )
docs.text: Returns a table corresponding to the color's current Colorize values: {R, G, B, A}

docs.title: table GetOffset ( )
docs.text:
Returns a table corresponding to the color's current Offset values: {R, G, B}

While the Color class does already contain .RO, .GO and .BO variables for this, GetOffset() has been measured to be ~30% faster in cases where access to all three values is necessary and is recommended in that scenario as a result. Performance is near identical when accessing two variables, and worse when accessing one. In cases where only one or two offset values are needed, stick with the variables.

docs.title: table GetTint ( )
docs.text: Returns a table corresponding to the color's current Tint values: {R, G, B, A}

docs.title: string Print ( )
docs.text: Returns a string representation of the color object.

docs.title: string __tostring ( )
docs.text:
Creates a string representation of the color object.

This enables direct printing of the object by doing print(myColorObj)

docs.title: Color EmberFade
docs.text:
Used for enemies like Crackles and Coal Spiders. This color has a hardcoded special property; gibs start orange and fade into grey.

Tint of (0, 0, 0, 1.1) Colorize of (0, 0, 0, 0) Offset of (1, 0.514, 0.004)

docs.title: Class "ColorModifier"
docs.text:
An example mod using the ColorModifier class can be found here.

Info

This class can be accessed by using its constructor:

Example Code 
local tintRed = ColorModifier(1,0,0,0.33,0,1)

docs.title: ColorModifier ColorModifier ( float R = 1, float G = 1, float B = 1, float A = 0, float Brightness = 0, float Contrast = 1 )
float A
docs.text:
Warning

This acts as a strength multiplier and must be non-zero in order for RGB to have any effect!

docs.title: ColorModifier __add ( ColorModifier right )
docs.text: Defines the addition of two ColorModifier objects using the + operator.

docs.title: ColorModifier __div ( ColorModifier right )
docs.text: Defines the division of a ColorModifier object and a float using the / operator. The ColorModifier must be on the left side.

docs.title: ColorModifier __eq ( ColorModifier right )
docs.text: Defines equal of two ColorModifier objects using the == operator.

docs.title: ColorModifier __mul ( ColorModifier right )
docs.text: Defines the multiplication of a ColorModifier object and a float using the * operator. The ColorModifier must be on the left side.

docs.title: ColorModifier __sub ( ColorModifier right )
docs.text: Defines the subtraction of two ColorModifier objects using the - operator.

docs.title: Class "ColorParams"
docs.text:
Info

This class can be accessed using its constructor:

Example Code 
local fiveSecondRedColor = ColorParams(Color(1,0,0,1),255,150,false,false)

docs.title: ColorParams ColorParams ( Color color, int priority, int duration1, int duration2, boolean fadeout, boolean shared )
int GetDuration ( )
docs.text: Defines the time in update frames that these parameters should last. Has no effect on how many frames are left, but does affect fadeout speed (calculated as Lifespan / Duration) if Fadeout is enabled.

docs.title: int GetLifespan ( )
docs.text: Defines how many update frames are left before this expires. This is decremented by 1 each non-interpolation update at a rate of 30 per second. Altering this will directly effect how many frames are left before these parameters expire.

docs.title: Global Class "Console"
docs.text:
Info

You can get this class by using the Console global table.

Note that to call these functions, you must use a . (period) instead of a : (colon)!

Example Code 
local cmdhistory = Console.GetCommandHistory()

docs.title: string[] GetCommandHistory ( )
docs.text: Returns a table containing current command history.

docs.title: string[] GetHistory ( )
docs.text:
Returns a table containing every previous entry printed to the console this run.

This is ordered last-to-first- the first entry will be the currently blank line awaiting user input, followed by the previous print, and so on. The last line will always be Repentance Console.

docs.title: void PopHistory ( int Amount = 1 )
docs.text: Removes previous lines from history. Optionally, use amount to define how many entries should be removed. The line currently awaiting user input in the console counts as a part of the history, but this is already accounted for on the C++ side.

docs.title: void PrintError ( string Error )
docs.text: Prints an error to the console, errors display in red text.

docs.title: void PrintWarning ( string Warning )
docs.text: Prints a warning to the console, warnings display in yellow text.

docs.title: void RegisterCommand ( string Name, string Desc, string HelpText, boolean ShowOnMenu, AutocompleteType Type )
docs.text:
Registers a command in the new console. These will show up in the new console's autocomplete.

  • Desc will show when typing the help command.
  • HelpText will show when typing help (Name).
  • AutocompleteType will make the command inherit that autocomplete type. If the command doesn't fit into any of the standard types, use CUSTOM combined with MC_CONSOLE_AUTOCOMPLETE to create a bespoke one for this command.

docs.title: void RegisterMacro ( string Name, string[] Commands )
docs.text:
Registers a macro in the new console. These will show up in the new console's autocomplete for the macro command.

  • Commands is a table of strings containing the commands that should be executed, in order.

ColorParams[] GetColorParams ( )
docs.text: Returns a table of all colors currently queued by SetColor alongside their parameters.

docs.title: int GetDamageCountdown ( )
docs.text:
If the entity recently took damage with the DAMAGE_COUNTDOWN DamageFlag, this returns how many more frames must pass before they can take damage with the DAMAGE_COUNTDOWN DamageFlag again.

Note that this is NOT the same as the player's invincibility frames (EntityPlayer:GetDamageCooldown()). The DAMAGE_COUNTDOWN DamageFlag and this associated countdown are typically used to control how rapidly an enemy will take damage from the few sources that uses that flag, such as the the collision damage effects from the "My Little Unicorn", "The Nail", and "The Gamekid".

docs.title: EntityConfigEntity GetEntityConfigEntity ( )
docs.text: Returns the corresponding EntityConfig entry for this entity.

docs.title: EntityNPC GetMinecart ( )
docs.text:
Returns the minecart the entity is riding.

Return

If the entity is not riding a minecart, this function returns nil.

docs.title: Vector GetNullOffset ( string NullLayerName )
docs.text: Returns position of null layer mark. Alternatively returns Vector.Zero if the layer is not visible, has no frame available for the current animation, or for other unknown reasons.

docs.title: PosVel GetPosVel ( )
docs.text: Returns 2 values, both Vectors. 1st the Position of the entity, 2nd the Velocity of the entity.

docs.title: Vector GetPredictedTargetPosition ( Entity Target, float Delay )
docs.text: The prediction is the target's current position plus their velocity multiplied by the distance between this and the target. Delay acts as a multiplier for how far ahead the prediction should be. For example, 1.0 would predict where the target's velocity would place them on the next update.

docs.title: EntityNPC GiveMinecart ( Vector Position, Vector Velocity )
boolean IgnoreEffectFromFriendly ( EntityRef Source )
docs.text: Used to determine if this entity should ignore any status effect coming from Source.

docs.title: EntityEffect MakeBloodPoof ( Vector Position = self.Position, Color Color = default, float Scale = 1.0 )
docs.text:
Info

This function spawns two effects; the second will be the the Child of the one returned.

docs.title: EntityEffect MakeGroundPoof ( Vector Position = self.Position, Color Color = default, float Scale = 1.0 )
docs.text:
Info

This function spawns two effects; the second will be the the Child of the one returned.

docs.title: void SetColorParams ( ColorParams[] Params )
docs.text: Sets colors to be used alongside their parameters.

docs.title: void SetDamageCountdown ( int countdown )
docs.text:
Sets how many frames must pass before the entity can take damage that has the DAMAGE_COUNTDOWN DamageFlag.

Note that this is NOT the same as the player's invincibility frames (EntityPlayer:GetDamageCooldown()). The DAMAGE_COUNTDOWN DamageFlag and this associated countdown are typically used to control how rapidly an enemy will take damage from the few sources that uses that flag, such as the the collision damage effects from the "My Little Unicorn", "The Nail", and "The Gamekid".

docs.title: EntityEffect SpawnBloodEffect ( int SubType = 0, Vector position = self.Position, Vector Offset = Vector.Zero, Color Color = Default, Vector Velocity = Vector.Zero )
void SpawnWaterImpactEffects ( Vector Position, Vector Velocity = Vector.Zero, float Strength )
docs.text:
Warning

This function will only spawn effects if the Room's water amount is above or equal to 0.2.

docs.title: EntityDelirium ToDelirium ( )
docs.text:
Convert an Entity userdata to an EntityDelirium userdata. The conversion will only succeed if the source entity is an instance of Delirium (in its normal form or in a transformed form).

Return behavior

If the conversion fails, this function returns nil.

docs.title: EntitySlot ToSlot ( )
docs.text:
Used to cast an Entity object to an EntitySlot object.

Return behavior

If the conversion is not successful, this function returns nil.

docs.title: Global Class "EntityConfig"
docs.text:
Info

These functions can be accessed via the EntityConfig global table.

Note that to call these functions, you must use a . (period) instead of a : (colon)!

Example Code 
local gaperConfig = EntityConfig.GetEntity(EntityType.ENTITY_GAPER)

docs.title: EntityConfigEntity GetEntity ( EntityType Type, int Variant = -1, int SubType = -1 )
docs.text:
Returns nil if no entity exists with the specified Type.

Providing Variant and/or SubType is optional. If a non-existent Variant/SubType is requested, returns the base version of that entity.

docs.title: int GetMaxPlayerType ( )
docs.text: Returns the highest PlayerType currently assigned to a valid character.

docs.title: EntityConfigPlayer GetPlayer ( PlayerType PlayerType )
docs.text: Returns nil if no character exists with the specified PlayerType.

docs.text:
Info

You can get this class by using the following functions:

  • EntityConfig.GetEntity()
Example Code 
local gaperConfig = EntityConfig.GetEntity(EntityType.ENTITY_GAPER)

docs.title: float GetCollisionRadius ( )
docs.text: Also known as "Size".

docs.title: const Vector GetCollisionRadiusMultiplier ( )
docs.text: Also known as "SizeMulti".

docs.title: table GetCustomTags ( )
docs.text: Returns a table containing all the strings specified in the entity's customtags attribute in entities2.xml. Tags are always provided in all lowercase. See entities2.xml for more information on customtags.

docs.title: int GetEntityTags ( )
docs.text: Returns the bitmask of EntityTags for this entity.

docs.title: int GetGibFlags ( )
docs.text: Returns the bitmask of GibFlags for this entity.

docs.title: string GetModName ( )
docs.text:
Name string of the mod that entity is from.

Returns nil for vanilla entities.

docs.title: float GetShadowSize ( )
docs.text: Note that this value is the "shadowSize" specified in the XML divided by 100.

docs.title: float GetShieldStrength ( )
docs.text: The amount of armor the entity has.

docs.title: boolean HasCustomTag ( string tag )
docs.text: Returns true if the entity has the provided string specified in its customtags attribute in entities2.xml. Capitalization does not matter. See entities2.xml for more information on customtags.

docs.title: boolean HasEntityTags ( int Tags )
docs.text: Returns true if the entity has all EntityTags specified in the provided bitset.

docs.title: boolean HasGibFlags ( int Flags )
docs.text: Returns true if the entity has all GibFlags specified in the provided bitset.

docs.title: Class "EntityConfigPlayer"
docs.text:
Info

You can get this class by using the following functions:

  • EntityConfig.GetPlayer()
Example Code 
local cainConfig = EntityConfig.GetPlayer(PlayerType.PLAYER_CAIN)

docs.title: Achievement GetAchievementID ( )
docs.text: Returns -1 if the character is not locked behind a vanilla achievement (or -2 for "hidden" vanilla characters).

docs.title: Card GetCard ( )
docs.text:
Returns 0 if the character does not start with any vanilla card.

Does not include starting cards obtained via unlocks.

Does not include cards added by mods.

docs.title: CollectibleType[] GetCollectibles ( )
docs.text: Returns a table of CollectibleTypes for the character's starting items.

docs.title: int GetCostumeID ( )
docs.text: Returns -1 if the character does not have any XML-defined starting costume (like Maggy's hair).

docs.title: string GetCostumeSuffix ( )
docs.text: Directory suffix used for character-specific costume sprites.

docs.title: string GetExtraPortraitPath ( )
docs.text: Path to a .anm2 file displayed on top of the character's level transition and boss VS screen portrait.

docs.title: Sprite GetModdedControlsSprite ( )
docs.text:
Returns the Sprite used for a modded character's starting room controls.

Note that this Sprite is shared by other characters from the same mod - there is an animation with the same name as this character.

Returns nil for vanilla characters, or characters with no corresponding animation.

docs.title: Sprite GetModdedCoopMenuSprite ( )
docs.text:
Returns the Sprite used for a modded character's icon in the co-op character select wheel.

Note that this Sprite is shared by other characters from the same mod - there is an animation with the same name as this character.

Returns nil for vanilla characters, or characters with no corresponding animation.

docs.title: Sprite GetModdedGameOverSprite ( )
docs.text:
Returns the Sprite used for a modded character's game over screen (ie, their name).

Note that this Sprite is shared by other characters from the same mod - there is an animation with the same name as this character.

Returns nil for vanilla characters, or characters with no corresponding animation.

docs.title: Sprite GetModdedMenuBackgroundSprite ( )
docs.text:
Returns the Sprite used for a modded character's character select screen.

Note that this Sprite is shared by other characters from the same mod - there is an animation with the same name as this character.

Returns nil for vanilla characters, or characters with no corresponding animation.

docs.title: Sprite GetModdedMenuPortraitSprite ( )
docs.text:
Returns the Sprite used for a modded character's character select portrait.

Note that this Sprite is shared by other characters from the same mod - there is an animation with the same name as this character.

Returns nil for vanilla characters, or characters with no corresponding animation.

docs.title: string GetNameImagePath ( )
docs.text: Path to the PNG file used for the character's name on the boss VS screen.

docs.title: PillColor GetPill ( )
docs.text: Does not include starting pills obtained via unlocks.

docs.title: CollectibleType GetPocketActive ( )
docs.text: Does not include items added by mods.

docs.title: string GetPortraitPath ( )
docs.text: Path to the PNG file used for the character's main level transition and boss VS screen portrait.

docs.title: string GetSkinPath ( )
docs.text: Path to the PNG file used for the character's primary sprite sheet.

docs.title: EntityConfigPlayer GetTaintedCounterpart ( )
docs.text:
For non-tainted characters, returns their tainted counterpart, or returns nil if there is none.

For tainted characters, returns their non-tainted counterpart.

docs.title: TrinketType GetTrinket ( )
docs.text:
Does not include starting trinkets obtained via unlocks.

Does not include trinkets added by mods.

docs.title: boolean IsHidden ( )
docs.text:
Returns true if the character is not visible/selectable from the character select screen.

Doesn't include characters who are only hidden until unlocked.

docs.title: int GetTeleportationTimer ( )
docs.text: Return the number of frames before Delirium teleports.

docs.title: boolean IsRedMode ( )
docs.text:
Returns a boolean indicating if the red mode is activated or not.

About red mode

Red mode is mechanic in the Delirium fight where Delirium's sprite is tinted red. While this mode is active, Delirium's movement speed is increased in a way that cannot be observed through the modding API as it occurs outside of the update callbacks.

docs.title: void SetRedMode ( boolean On )
docs.text:
Enable or disable red mode according to the parameter on.

About red mode

Please refer to the note in the documentation of IsRedMode for an explanation of red mode.

docs.title: void SetTeleportationTimer ( int Timer )
docs.text: Set the number of frames before Delirium teleports. Negative values are not allowed.

docs.title: void Transform ( int Type, int Variant = 0 )
docs.text:
Transform Delirium into the entity with the specified type and variant.

Warning

The validation of the type and variant is only as strong as the validation performed by the game when it attempts to transform Delirium. In other words, this behaves exactly as if the game itself attempted to transform Delirium, with everything it implies if the specified entity is invalid.

Warning

In order to properly handle transformations, we use the native transformation mechanic of Delirium. As such, the transformation will not be effective immediately, but instead on the next frame. Internally, this function forces the transformation timer to 1 frame and lets Delirium's AI update as needed.

docs.title: int8 Angle
docs.text:
Angle of Delirium's projectiles.

Geometric system

This variable is an eight bit integers, so the allowed values are the integers from 0 to 255 (inclusive). You can use a linear interpolation between the [0: 255] and the [0: 360[ ranges in order to convert angles in degree to this system.

WTH

All of Delirium bullet hell patterns can be influenced by this variable. Unlike most bosses, Delirium does not aim its projectiles at the player, instead spawning them in random directions (with some control to prevent "absurd" patterns). For instance, if Delirium spawns eight tears around it, and Angle is set to 0, the 8 tears will fire in the cardinal and ordinal directions. If Angle is set to 32, all tears will be rotated by 45°. No, I have no idea why Nicalis used an eight bits integer to represent an angle (analyzing the memory layout of Delirium shows that it would have made no difference using a 32 bits float).

docs.title: int AttackID
docs.text: Internal I1 value used by Delirium to identify the bullet hell pattern it is currently executing.

docs.title: int BossType
docs.text: EntityType of the boss Delirium is currently transformed as.

docs.title: int BossVariant
docs.text: Variant of the boss Delirium is currently transformed as.

docs.title: int Cycle
docs.text:
Internal I2 value used by Delirium to identify whether red mode is activated and the amount of time before a teleportation. You should not use this variable directly and instead rely on the GetTeleportationTimer, SetTeleportationTimer, IsRedMode and SetRedMode functions instead. The only reason to use this variable directly is if you want to freeze it to a certain value that you know will do exactly what you want (for instance disable red mode and prevent teleportation).

Format of the variable

The variable is 32 bits wide and is structured as follows: bits 0 to 6 (inclusive) are unknown, bits 7 to 14 (inclusive) indicate whether red mode is active (it is active if any of the bits is set) and bits 15 to 25 (inclusive) are the teleportation timer.

Preservation of state

The aforementioned methods used to manipulate this variable preserve the bits of the variable that are irrelevant to the operation performed. For instance, enabling or disabling red mode will not change the transformation timer.

docs.title: int RemainingAttacks
docs.text:
Number of attacks remaining before Delirium transforms into another boss.

About remaining attacks

This variable is Nicalis answer to prevent Delirium from performing too many attacks as a single boss before transforming. Under certain conditions, the game will decrement this value by 1. If it reaches 0, Delirium transforms regardless of the transformation timer. The conditions that must be met (simultaneously) are: the StateFrame variable must be 1 during the current frame, and the State variable must be set to any of the attack states. This is the reason why Delirium will sometimes initiate an attack as a boss and immediately transform. You can refer to the complete breakdown of bosses AI configurations to see the AI configuration of each attack.

docs.title: NpcState StateD
docs.text: Internal State of Delirium.

docs.title: int TransformationTimer
docs.text:
Get or set the amount of time before Delirium transforms into another boss.

On transformations

Delirium can transform in two situations: either this value reaches 0, or the value of RemainingAttacks reaches 0. Refer to the documentation of RemainingAttacks for a more detailed explanation of that mechanic.

docs.title: int GetControllerId ( )
docs.text: Returns the ControllerId for the NPC, which indicates which player is controlling it. Will return -1 when not being controlled by any player.

docs.title: Color GetDirtColor ( )
docs.text: Returns the dynamic dirt color of the entity. This lets entities like Nightcrawler blend in to the environment.

docs.title: int SetControllerId ( int ControllerId )
docs.text: Sets the ControllerId for the NPC, which indicates which player will control it. Set it to -1 for no player controls(back to normal behaviour).

docs.title: EntityNPC ShootMaggotProjectile ( Vector Target, float Velocity = -24.0, float YOffset = -8.0 )

EntityNPC ThrowStrider ( Entity Source, Vector Target )
boolean TryForceTarget ( Entity Target, int Duration )
docs.text: Used by Lost Fly to force this NPC to focus on a specific target.

docs.title: boolean TryThrow ( EntityRef Source, Vector Direction, float Force )
docs.text:
Info

Force only applies to NPC poop (it's modified and then used as V1.y, with V1.x being -20.0) and may be incorrect. This needs further investigation.

docs.title: void UpdateDirtColor ( boolean Immediate )
docs.text:
Instructs the entity to update its dirt color. This is generally done automatically on vanilla entities, but up until now, modded ones have been quite limited in this reagard.

If Immediate is set, the dirt color will be set to exactly what is beneath the entity. Otherwise, it will be updated smoothly over the course of multiple frames.

docs.title: Vector V1
docs.text: Fix of original function that now correctly returns a pointer to the Vector.

docs.title: Vector V2
docs.text: Fix of original function that now correctly returns a pointer to the Vector.

docs.text: Returns whether a collectible is being hidden by the Curse of the Blind question mark graphics. Always returns false for non-collectible EntityPickups.

docs.text: Sets the graphics of the item pedestal. Does nothing for non-collectible EntityPickups.

docs.title: void SetForceBlind ( boolean SetBlind )
docs.text: Hides pedestal items similar to Curse of the Blind. Does nothing for non-collectible EntityPickups.

docs.title: int SetNewOptionsPickupIndex ( )
docs.text: Returns the new pickup index.

docs.title: boolean TryRemoveCollectible ( )
docs.text:
Attempts to remove the collectible from an item pedestal.

Returns true if a collectible was successfully removed from the pedestal. Returns false if the pedestal was already empty, or if called on a non-collectible EntityPickup.

This magically vanished from the API some time after 1.7.8.

Compared to the vanilla function, this implementation has been further augmented to throw an error if LoopIndex is higher than MultiShotParams:GetNumTears().

docs.text: Returns the true amount of charge added, which may have been capped by the targeted item's MaxCharge.

docs.text:
Bug

Currently this function directly modifies the contents of WispCollectiblesList, so if this list was updated on wisp init/delete, or the player exits the run, your added innate items will not be saved.

Returns true if the trinket was successfully added, otherwise false.

docs.title: boolean CanUsePill ( PillEffect ID )
docs.text: By some conditions, usually health-related, determines whether a player can use a given pill effect.

docs.title: EntityFamiliar[] CheckFamiliarEx ( int FamiliarVariant Familiar, int TargetCount, RNG rng, ItemConfigItem SourceItemConfigItem = nil, int FamiliarSubType = -1 )
docs.text: A version of CheckFamiliar that returns all familiars spawned by the function as a table.

docs.title: void DropCollectible ( CollectibleType Collectible, EntityPickup ExistingPedestal = nil, boolean RemoveFromPlayerForm = false )
docs.text: If ExistingPedestal is set, the collectible it contains will be swapped out for the dropped collectible instead of a new pedestal spawning.

docs.title: EntityPickup DropCollectibleByHistoryIndex ( int Idx, EntityPickup ExistingPedestal = nil )
docs.text: If ExistingPedestal is set, the collectible it contains will be swapped out for the dropped collectible instead of a new pedestal spawning.

docs.title: void EnableWeaponType ( WeaponType Weapon, boolean Set )
EntityEffect FireBrimstoneBall ( Vector Position, Vector Velocity, Vector Offset = Vector.Zero )
docs.text:
Info

If the player has Tech X, this function will fire an EntityLaser as well. The laser will have the Brimstone ball effect as a parent, it's unclear if the effect also links back to the laser.

docs.title: BagOfCraftingPickup GetBagOfCraftingSlot ( int SlotID )
docs.text: Gets the current content of the bag in the given Slot ID.

docs.title: table GetCollectiblesList ( )
docs.text:
Returns a table with the amount of each collectible the player has without counting innate items.

Example Code

This code prints how many sad onions the player has.

local collectiblesList = player:GetCollectiblesList()

print(collectiblesList[CollectibleType.COLLECTIBLE_SAD_ONION])

docs.title: table GetCostumeLayerMap ( )
docs.text:
Returns table of player sprite layers data for costumes with the following fields:

Field Type Comment costumeIndex int Index of active/visible costume for layer. layerID int priority int isBodyLayer boolean

docs.title: CostumeSpriteDesc[] GetCostumeSpriteDescs ( )
docs.text: Returns a table of CostumeSpriteDesc.

docs.title: int GetDamageModifier ( )
docs.text: For Experimental Treatement, returns -1, 0 or 1 depending on the damage rolled.

docs.title: int GetFireDelayModifier ( )
docs.text: For Experimental Treatement, returns -1, 0 or 1 depending on the fire delay rolled.

docs.title: EntityPlayer GetFlippedForm ( )
docs.text:
Returns flipped form of the current character. (only used for Tainted Lazarus)

Otherwise, returns nil.

docs.title: Entity GetFocusEntity ( )
docs.text: Returns the entity used by Active Camera to determine where the camera should focus. This can be either the Marked target EntityEffect or a weapon's entity. If none of these exist, this returns nil.

docs.title: table GetGlyphOfBalanceDrop ( int Variant = -1, int SubType = -1 )
docs.text: Returns a table containing the variant and subtype of the possible Glyph of Balance drop.

docs.title: Entity GetHeldEntity ( )
docs.text: Returns the Entity that the player is holding over their head, such as with throwable red bombs or Suplex! Returns nil if no entity is currently being held.

docs.title: Sprite GetHeldSprite ( )
docs.text: Gets the Sprite object used for when the player is doing an animation that involves holding a sprite over their head, such as active item usage.

docs.title: int GetKeepersSackBonus ( )
docs.text: Gets the number of coins spent while possessing Keeper's Sack.

docs.title: int GetLuckModifier ( )
docs.text: For Experimental Treatement, returns -1, 0 or 1 depending on the luck rolled.

docs.title: int GetMaggySwingCooldown ( )
docs.text: Used for Tainted Magdalene's hugging attack.

docs.title: EntityEffect GetMarkedTarget ( )
docs.text: Returns the entity effect representing the target of the Marked item. If the target is not displayed on the ground, this function returns nil.

docs.title: int GetNextUrethraBlockFrame ( )
docs.text: Returns the frame at which the player stops shooting and starts charging the Kidney Stone item.

docs.title: int GetPeeBurstCooldown ( )
docs.text: Returns the attack duration of the Kidney Stone item.

docs.title: PurityState GetPurityState ( )
docs.text: Returns the state in which the Purity item effect currently is.

docs.title: int GetShotSpeedModifier ( )
docs.text: For Experimental Treatement, returns -1, 0 or 1 depending on the shot speed rolled.

docs.title: table GetSmeltedTrinkets ( )
docs.text:
Returns a table of smelted trinkets and their corresponding amounts. The returned table contains the following fields:

Field Type Comment trinketAmount int goldenTrinketAmount int

docs.title: int GetSpeedModifier ( )
docs.text: For Experimental Treatement, returns -1, 0 or 1 depending on the speed rolled.

docs.title: CollectibleType[] GetVoidedCollectiblesList ( )
docs.text: Retuns a table containing the CollectibleTypes of all voided Active items.

docs.title: Weapon GetWeapon ( int Slot )
docs.text: Slot needs to be between 0 and 4.

docs.title: boolean HasInstantDeathCurse ( )
docs.text: Returns true when the player is in the Lost form triggered by either the white fire in Downpour or Soul of The Lost. (or when in Tainted Jacob's ghost form when being touched by Dark Esau)

docs.title: void IncrementPlayerFormCounter ( PlayerForm Form, int Count )
docs.text:
Info

Count can be negative to decrement the PlayerForm.

docs.title: void InitPostLevelInitStats ( )
docs.text: Call this after spawning characters with "special" tears (Forgotten, Lilith, Azazel etc) with InitTwin, or they won't have their proper tear type.

docs.title: EntityPlayer InitTwin ( PlayerType PlayerType )
docs.text:
I believe this is used by J&E, Strawman etc.

Bug

The twin player will desync from its main twin on save and continue. This softlocks the game in singleplayer, as the game prompts for a controller.

We've received confirmation from _Kilburn that this is hardcoded to be handled on vanilla characters. We will need to add a workaround for this.

docs.title: boolean IsCollectibleAnimFinished ( CollectibleType Collectible, string Animation )
boolean IsCollectibleCostumeVisible ( CollectibleType Collectible, int PlayerSpriteLayerID )
boolean IsCollectibleCostumeVisible ( CollectibleType Collectible, string PlayerSpriteLayerName )
boolean IsItemCostumeVisible ( ItemConfig_Item Item, int PlayerSpriteLayerID )
boolean IsItemCostumeVisible ( ItemConfig_Item Item, int PlayerSpriteLayerName )
boolean IsNullItemCostumeVisible ( int nullItem, int layerID = 0 )
boolean IsNullItemCostumeVisible ( int nullItem, string layerName )
boolean IsUrethraBlocked ( )
docs.text: Returns true when the player can no longer shoot due to charging the Kidney Stone item.

docs.title: void PlayCollectibleAnim ( CollectibleType Collectible, boolean CheckBodyLayers, string AnimationName, int Frame = -1 )
void PlayDelayedSFX ( SoundEffect ID, int SoundDelay = 0, int FrameDelay = 2, float Volume = 1.0 )
void RemovePoopSpell ( int Position = 0 )
docs.text: Removes the poop spell from the specified queue position and shifts all spells after it forward to fill the space. A new spell is randomly picked to fill the last position.

docs.title: void RerollAllCollectibles ( RNG rng, boolean includeActiveItems )
void ResetPlayer ( )
docs.text:
Info

This is used by the Genesis active item.

docs.title: void SalvageCollectible ( EntityPickup Pickup, RNG rng = PickupDropRNG, ItemPoolType Pool = ItemPoolType.POOL_NULL)
void SalvageCollectible ( CollectibleType Collectible, Vector position = playerPosition, RNG rng = PlayerDropRNG, ItemPoolType Pool = ItemPoolType.POOL_NULL )
docs.text:
Info

The provided EntityPickup will be removed by this function. Use the override to avoid this.

docs.title: void SetActiveVarData ( int VarData, ActiveSlot Slot )
void SetBagOfCraftingContent ( BagOfCraftingPickup[] ContentTable )
docs.text: Sets the content of the bag to the content of the table. Table must use valid BagOfCraftingPickup ids. Table can be shorter than 8, in which case the remaining indexes are set to empty.

docs.title: void SetBagOfCraftingSlot ( int SlotID, int PickupID )
void SetBladderCharge ( int Charge )
docs.text:
Used by the Kidney Stone item.

Bug

The player's head turns pitch black when this function is used without Kidney Stone.

docs.title: boolean SetCanShoot ( boolean CanShoot )
docs.text: Instantaneously disables (or enables) the player's ability to shoot. The base game primarily uses this for special challenges.

docs.title: void SetFootprintColor ( KColor color, boolean RightFoot = false )
void SetItemState ( CollectibleType Collectible )
docs.text: This is used for thrown/2-input items (e.g. Bob's Rotten Head).

docs.title: void SetKeepersSackBonus ( int Bonus )
docs.text: This is the number of coins spent while possessing Keeper's Sack.

docs.title: void SetPoopSpell ( int Slot, PoopSpellType PoopSpellType )
void SetPurityState ( PurityState State )
docs.text: Set the state in which the Purity item effect currently is.

docs.title: void SetWeapon ( Weapon Weapon, int WeaponSlot )
void ShuffleCostumes ( int Seed = Random( ) )
docs.text: Randomizes the current costumes.

docs.title: EntityEffect SpawnAquariusCreep ( TearParams TearParams = self.TearParams)
docs.text:
Spawns a creep effect that acts like the ones created by Aquarius, including inhereting the player's TearParams. Supports passing a custom TearParams instead.

Info

For reference, this is how the game calculates the TearParams for this normally:

player->GetTearHitParams(&params, WeaponType.WEAPON_TEARS, (*player->GetTearPoisonDamage() * 0.666f) / player->_damage, -(int)(-Isaac::Random(2) != 0) & 2 - 1, nil)

docs.title: void SpawnClot ( Vector pos, boolean AllowPlayerDeath = false )
docs.text: Acts like a use of Sumptorium, removing health and spawning a clot with the type of health removed. If AllowPlayerDeath is set, a clot will spawn even if the health drained will kill the player.

docs.title: void SwapForgottenForm ( boolean Force = false, boolean NoEffects = false)
docs.text:
If the player has a SubPlayer, swaps between them. Force will swap even if the subplayer doesn't have any health, or while a room/stage transition is active. NoEffects will disable the dust effect & fade from white when switching from The Soul to The Forgotten.

Warning

This function currently only has an effect for The Forgotten and The Soul.

docs.title: void SyncConsumableCounts ( EntityPlayer Player, int CollectibleFlags )
void Teleport ( Vector Position, boolean DoEffects = true, boolean TeleportTwinPlayers = false )
docs.text:
Teleports the player to a position within the room.

DoEffects controls whether the teleport animation and sound plays. TeleportTwinPlayers controls whether twin players (e.g. Esau, Tainted Lazarus w/ Birthright) are teleported alongside this one.

docs.title: void TryDecreaseGlowingHourglassUses ( int Uses, boolean ForceHourglass = false )
docs.text:
ForceHourglass instantly removes all the charges and turns Glowing Hourglass into it's regular Hourglass form.

Bug

Uses are only decreased by 1 regardless of how large of a number you tell it to remove.

docs.title: boolean TryPreventDeath ( )
docs.text:
Adds a heart container to a character if there are none left, depending on its HealthType.

Returns true on success, otherwise false.

docs.title: void UpdateIsaacPregnancy ( boolean UpdateCambion )
docs.text: Set true if you want to update the Cambion Conception costume, otherwise updates the Immaculate Conception costume.

docs.text: Returns a random string from the following options: CoinJam, CoinJam2, CoinJam3, CoinJam4. Presumably only used on the donation machines.

docs.title: void SetPrizeCollectible ( CollectibleType Collectible )
docs.text: Seems to only be used by Crane Game and Hell Game. This sets the collectible that the games will pay out with, and updates the rendered collectible accordingly.

docs.title: Class "FXParams"
docs.text:
Info

You can get this class by using the following functions:

  • Room:GetFXParams()
Example Code 
local fxparams = Game():GetRoom():GetFXParams()

docs.title: ColorModifier ColorModifier
docs.text:
Gets a modifiable copy of the color correction introduced in Repentance. This stores the values used in fxlayers.xml and not the raw values (see GetCurrentColorModifier for this).

Changes made here are not automatically applied, use UpdateColorModifier to do this.

docs.title: boolean UseWaterV2
docs.text: If set, water will use the reflective shader featured in Downpour and Dross.

docs.title: Font,bool Font ( string FontPath )
docs.text: Added optional "FontPath" argument, the function now returns two values: Font object and the bool signifying whether the font was loaded successfully or not.

docs.title: void DrawString ( string String, float PositionX, float PositionY, KColor RenderColor, int BoxWidth = 0, boolean Center = false )
docs.text: Same as default function, but with better input validation to prevent crashes.

docs.title: void DrawStringScaled ( string String, float PositionX, float PositionY, float ScaleX, float ScaleY, KColor RenderColor, int BoxWidth = 0, boolean Center = false )
docs.text: Same as default function, but with better input validation to prevent crashes.

docs.title: void DrawStringScaledUTF8 ( string String, float PositionX, float PositionY, float ScaleX, float ScaleY, KColor RenderColor, int BoxWidth = 0, boolean Center = false )
docs.text: Same as default function, but with better input validation to prevent crashes.

docs.title: void DrawStringUTF8 ( string String, float PositionX, float PositionY, KColor RenderColor, int BoxWidth = 0, boolean Center = false )
docs.text: Same as default function, but with better input validation to prevent crashes.

docs.title: int GetStringWidth ( string String )
docs.text: Same as default function, but with better input validation to prevent crashes.

docs.title: int GetStringWidthUTF8 ( string String )
docs.text: Same as default function, but with better input validation to prevent crashes.

docs.title: LevelStage GetLastDevilRoomStage ( )
docs.text: Now returns integer instead of unusable userdata.

docs.title: LevelStage GetLastLevelWithDamage ( )
docs.text: Now returns integer instead of unusable userdata.

docs.title: LevelStage GetLastLevelWithoutHalfHp ( )
docs.text: Now returns integer instead of unusable userdata.

docs.title: EntityPlayer GetPlayer ( int Index )
docs.text: If no players exist, this now returns nil to prevent a crash. Invalid indexes will return index 0.

docs.title: void StartStageTransition ( boolean SameStage, int TransitionOverride, EntityPlayer Player = nil )
docs.text: Fixed the crash that sometimes occured due to an incorrect call on the C++ side. Player is now optional (will default to GetPlayer(0)).

docs.title: boolean AchievementUnlocksDisallowed ( )
docs.text: Returns true if achievements can't be unlocked this run (challenges, seeded, etc).

docs.title: void AddDebugFlags ( DebugFlag Flag )
docs.text: Adds a debug flag to the game. Multiple can be added simultaneously with bitwise concatenation (e.g. DebugFlag.ENTITY_POSITIONS | DebugFlag.HITSPHERES).

docs.title: ColorModifier GetCurrentColorModifier ( )
docs.text: Gets a copy of the color correction introduced in Repentance. This stores the raw values currently being used (which can be affected by items such as Astral Projection) and not what the room is set to use (see FXParams.ColorModifier for this).

docs.title: int GetDebugFlags ( )
docs.text: Returns a DebugFlag bitmask.

docs.title: ColorModifier GetLerpColorModifier ( )
docs.text:
Info

This is formatted as the absolute rate of change (ie, all values are positive).

docs.title: int GetPlanetariumsVisited ( )
docs.text: Returns the amount of planetariums the player has entered this run.

docs.title: ColorModifier GetTargetColorModifier ( )
docs.text: If currently lerping between two ColorModifier states, returns the target state. Is otherwise the same as GetCurrentColorModifier.

docs.title: boolean IsErased ( int Type, int Variant = -1, int SubType = -1 )
docs.text: Checks if an entity was erased.

docs.title: boolean IsHardMode ( )

docs.title: Class "HUD"
docs.text:
Info

You can get this class by using the following functions:

  • Game:GetHUD()
Example Code 
local hud = Game():GetHUD()
local sprite = hud:GetChargeBarSprite()

docs.title: float GetBossHPBarFill ( )
docs.text: Get the fill of the boss hp bar

docs.title: Sprite GetCardsPillsSprite ( )
docs.text: Sprite object used to render pills, cards and rune sprites in the hud.

docs.title: Sprite GetCoopMenuSprite ( )
docs.text: Sprite object used to render the coop player selection menu.

docs.title: Sprite GetCraftingSprite ( )
docs.text: Sprite object used for bag of crafting hud.

docs.title: Sprite GetFortuneSprite ( )
docs.text: Sprite object used for the fortune popup window.

docs.title: Sprite GetInventorySprite ( )
docs.text: Sprite object used for Tainted Isaac inventory system.

docs.title: Sprite GetPoopSpellSprite ( )
docs.text: Tainted blue baby poop spell sprite

docs.title: Sprite GetStreakSprite ( )
docs.text: Sprite object used for text streak popups. For example: picking up items, displaying floor name, etc.

docs.title: void SetBossHPBarFill ( float percent )
docs.text: Sets the fill of the boss hp bar. Accepts values between 0 and 1. Numbers below 0 cause the boss hp bar to not be rendered.

docs.title: Class "History"
docs.text:
Info

You can get this class by using the following functions:

Info

You can get this class by using the global table "ImGui"

Example Code 
local isblind = ImGui.GetVisible("braillemenu")

docs.title: Reference
docs.text: For element types we use the same names as in ImGui itself. Check out the interactive ImGui example.

docs.title: Icons
docs.text:
All imgui text supports the usage of icons. Right now, we use "FontAwesome 6", which provides ~1400 icons. You can search for fitting icons here: https://fontawesome.com/search?o=r&m=free&s=solid

Icon usage in Lua:

If you want to add an Icon into your widget, just use the "Unicode" representation of the icon and put it in between a \u{ } string. You can find this, by selecting the icon on the fontawesome page, and looking in the top right corner of the popup-window. You can add it to your element like this:

"\u{f0f9} My Text"

This will add the "truck-medical" icon in front of the text "My text".

Result: " My Text"

docs.text:
Adds a Combobox element which represents a single line element that allows you to select a value from a dropdown menu. If isSlider is set to true, instead of a dropdown menu, the values can be selected by interacting with a slider element.

Example Code 
ImGui.AddCombobox("catInput", "combobox1", "Combobox", function(index, val) print(index, val) end, { "Item 1", "Item 2", "Item 3" }, 1)

docs.text:
Adds a color input element. If the parameter a is set, it acts as an RGBA input. Otherwise its just an RGB input. The float values are between 0 and 1.

The callback gets passed the r,g,b and a values as seperate parameters.

Example Code 
ImGui.AddInputColor("catInput", "inputColorRGB", "RGB input", function(r, g, b) print(r, g, b) end, 1, 0.25, 0.45)
ImGui.AddInputColor("catInput", "inputColorRGBA", "RGBA input", function(r, g, b, a) print(r, g, b, a) end, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5,
    0.5)

docs.text:
Adds a progressbar element. The progress value defines the fill percentage (0 to 1).

If the overlayText was not defined, the progressbar will display the current fill state in percent inside the progressbar (for example 50% when progress is set to 0.5).

If the label is empty, the progressbar will render over the full width of the parent element.

docs.title: void CenterCursor ( )
docs.text:
Moves the windows mouse cursor to the center of the game's window. This is incredibly niche but useful if you want to use cursor controls for anything fancy and have full control over it. It wont move the cursor if Isaac.exe becomes out of focus.

Note

Take in mind the screen center is NOT the center of the room necessarily, it's just the center of the game's window(center of the actual screen if you are on fullscreen).

docs.title: EntityEffect CreateTimer ( function Function, int Interval, int Times, boolean Persistent )
docs.text:
Spawns a timer EntityEffect. This entity will starting running Function function after Interval frames, and will repeat it Times amount of times. Persistent controls whether or not this timer "dies" in the current room, or persists across rooms.

Timer behavior

This timer is called every game update. This means the timer only takes into consideration frames in which the game is actively running, not paused, and uses update frames for its Delay parameter (30 frames per second).

If your use case requires that a timer takes paused time into account, stick with a custom timer running on a RENDER callback.

docs.title: table GetCompletionMarks ( PlayerType Character)
docs.text:
Returns a table containing all the marks for the character. Supports both modded and vanilla characters.

Table structure & usage
  • The table has the following fields:
    • PlayerType: containing the PlayerType asociated to the marks
    • MomsHeart: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Isaac: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Satan: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • BossRush: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • BlueBaby: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Lamb: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • MegaSatan: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • UltraGreed: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Hush: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • UltraGreedier: Mostly redundant with UltraGreed when it has a value of 2, no need to set it
    • Delirium: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Mother: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Beast: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion 
      local marks = Isaac.GetCompletionMarks(0)
if (marks.MomsHeart > 0) then
    print("got mom")
end
if (marks.Lamb >= 2) then
    print("GOATED ON H4RD")
end
if (Isaac.GetCompletionMarks(0).Delirium > 0) then --doing it the lazy way, fitting deliriums theme
    print("Got Deli")
end

docs.title: void SetCompletionMarks ( table Marks )
docs.text:
Sets the completion marks of a character to match an input table. Supports both modded and vanilla characters. Requires a table containing all the marks for the character, getting it from GetCompletionMarks is adviced for convenience.

Table structure & usage
  • The table needs the following fields:
    • PlayerType: containing the PlayerType asociated to the marks
    • MomsHeart: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Isaac: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Satan: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • BossRush: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • BlueBaby: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Lamb: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • MegaSatan: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • UltraGreed: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Hush: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • UltraGreedier: Mostly redundant with UltraGreed when it has a value of 2, no need to set it
    • Delirium: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Mother: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion
    • Beast: value of Difficulty 0-2 indicating the completion 
      local marks = Isaac.GetCompletionMarks(0) --getting the current table
marks.MomsHeart = 2 --Isaac now will have the hard mark on MHeart
marks.Satan = 1 --Isaac will now have the normal mark on Satan
marks.BlueBaby = 0 --Removes the BlueBaby Mark if its present
Isaac.SetCompletionMarks(marks) --Impacts the changes on the player

docs.title: int PlaceRoom ( int Column, int Row, RoomShape Shape, LevelGeneratorRoom Origin )
docs.text:
Place a LevelGeneratorRoom object onto the level-grid. The Origin parameter is used as the index of the connecting room. For instance, if you want to place a room on top of the starting room, then Origin can be the starting room of the floor.

The column and row values need to be between 0 and 12 (inclusive).

Returns the GenerationIndex of the placed room. If placement was not possible, returns nil.

Multiple origins

The Origin parameter is used to ensure consistency with the existing rooms. During the generation phase, the game always picks a room and starts placing rooms around it. This parameter reflects this behavior.

When placing a room, you may be wondering which of its neighbors must act as the origin. This has consequences on the placement of special rooms, as the game places special rooms in a specific order based on the distance between each dead end room and the start of the floor. The distance from the start of the floor of the new room is equal to the distance from the start of the floor of Origin plus one. In practice you are free to chose any neighboring room as a point of origin.

Class "LevelGeneratorRoom"
docs.text:
Info

This class is used during level generation. Its purpose is to represent a slot in the graph of rooms that is generated during the generation phase.

This class is immutable and cannot be instanciated manually: you cannot change the value of the fields of an instance and you cannot instance it by yourself.

Access to instances is always performed through methods of the LevelGenerator itself, or instances are given as parameters of the callbacks:

  • MC_PRE_LEVEL_PLACE_ROOM

docs.title: int Column ( )
docs.text: Return the column of the room slot on the level grid (index is 0 based).

docs.title: int DoorMask ( )
docs.text:
Return a mask of the available doors of the room slot. In order to check if a door at a given slot is available, use the DoorSlot enumeration.

Example

This tests if the DoorSlot LEFT0 is available. 

if room:DoorMask() & (1 << DoorSlot.LEFT0) then
    print ("Room has a door on slot LEFT0)
end

docs.title: int GenerationIndex ( )
docs.text: Index of the room during generation: 0 if the room was the first to be generated, 1 if it was the second etc.

docs.title: int[] Neighbors ( )
docs.text: Returns a table of the generation indices of the neighboring rooms.

docs.title: int Row ( )
docs.text: Return the row of the room slot on the level grid (index is 0 based).

docs.title: int Shape ( )
docs.text: Return the shape of the room, as per the RoomShape enumeration.

docs.title: float GetMultiEyeAngle ( )
docs.text:
When more than one eye is active, defines the angle the eyes are offset to eachother. Similar to cross eye effect.

Example: for The Wiz, this is 45.

docs.title: int GetNumEyesActive ( )
docs.text: Returns the number of eyes simultaniously shooting. Examples: For The Wiz, its 2, for mutant Spider its 1.

docs.title: int GetNumLanesPerEye ( )
docs.text:
Returns the amount of lanes used to spread the shot tears onto. Lane positions are calculated by dividing the area, defined by the shooting direction +- the spreadAngle, by the number of lanes. This will create a pattern similar to a symetrical hand fan. Normally the number of lanes should be the same number as the amount of tears divided by the number of eyes.

A smaller number of lanes than the amount of tears will cause tears to overlap each other. A higher lane count than tears will make the fan pattern asymetrical.

docs.text:
Number of half hearts of damage dealt by the projectile. Cannot be set to a negative value.

Info

This value ignores the full heart damage modifier applied to projectiles with a Scale above 1.15, but non-boss champions will still double it (with a caveat, read warning below!).

docs.title: Global Class "StageTransition"
docs.text:
Info

This class gives access to data exclusive to the stage transition screen.

Please note that the StageTransition is only used to configure how the stage transition plays. If you want to manipulate the content of the screen during a stage transition, you need to use the NightmareScene class.

You can get this class by using the StageTransition global table.

Example Code 
local samestage = StageTransition.GetSameStage()

docs.title: boolean GetSameStage ( )
docs.text: Indicate if the stage transition screen will display Isaac's head moving from one stage to the other (false) or not (true).

docs.title: void SetSameStage ( boolean Value )
docs.text:
Configure whether the stage transition will display Isaac's head moving from one stage to the other (false) or not (true).

This function is useful if you want to move the player to the first stage, or want to repeat the last stage on the progress bar of the transition screen, and have it be less jarring.

  • If transitioning back to the first floor, and SameStage is not set to true, Isaac's head will appear outside of the progress bar. Otherwise, Isaac's head will appear on the first floor.
  • If repeating the last floor, and SameStage is not set to true, Isaac's head will move from the previous stage to the last one. Otherwise, Isaac's head will appear on the last floor.
Warning

Calling this method before the current stage transition has called SetNextStage will override the transition itself. This means that instead of merely displaying Isaac's head not moving, it will actually change whether the next stage will be a repeat of the current one, or the actual next stage. Ideally, you should use this function in the context of the ModCallbacks.MC_PRE_LEVEL_SELECT callback.

Class "WeightedOutcomePicker"
docs.text:
An example mod using the WeightedOutcomePicker class can be found here.

Info

This class can be obtained using its constructor:

Example Code 
local wop = WeightedOutcomePicker()

docs.title: void AddOutcomeFloat ( int Value, float Weight, int ScaleFactor = 100 )
docs.text:
Adds an outcome to the outcome selector with the specified Weight. The internal weight is still an integer calculated like this: fWeight * scaleFactor, where ScaleFactor is the maximum weight (equivalent to 1.0).

Example Code 
local picker = WeightedOutcomePicker()

picker:AddOutcomeFloat(1, 1.0) -- ~45%
picker:AddOutcomeFloat(2, 1.0) -- ~45%
picker:AddOutcomeFloat(3, 0.2) -- ~9%

docs.title: void AddOutcomeWeight ( int Value, int Weight )
docs.text:
Adds an outcome to the outcome selector with the specified Weight.

Example Code 
local picker = WeightedOutcomePicker()

picker:AddOutcomeWeight(1, 65) -- 65%
picker:AddOutcomeWeight(2, 30) -- 30%
picker:AddOutcomeWeight(3, 5) -- 5%

docs.title: void ClearOutcomes ( )
docs.text: Clears all outcomes from the outcome picker.

docs.title: int GetNumOutcomes ( )
docs.text: Returns the number of outcomes in the outcome picker.

docs.title: table[] GetOutcomes ( )
docs.text:
Returns a table containing a list of all outcomes in the outcome picker.

Table structure & usage
  • The returned table contains a list of outcomes, where each outcome is a table containing the following fields:
    • Value: value of the outcome
    • Weight: weight of the outcome 
      for i, outcome in ipairs(p:GetOutcomes()) do
    print(outcome.Value, outcome.Weight)
end

docs.title: int PickOutcome ( RNG RNG )
docs.text: Returns a random outcome from the list in WeightedOutcomePicker. Accepts RNG.

docs.title: void RemoveOutcome ( int Value )
docs.text: Removes an outcome from the outcome picker with the given Value.

docs.title: Global Class "XMLData"
docs.text:
Info

A public table containing all the functions related to gathering XML attributes accross the different XMLs with updated values to match the real values.

You can get this class by using the XMLData global table.

Note that to call these functions, you must use a . (period) instead of a : (colon)!

Example Code 
local numEntries = XMLData.GetNumEntries(XMLNode.ENTITY)
Warning

XML attributes are converted to lowercase when being parsed by REPENTOGON! This eliminates capitializtion inconsistency in vanilla tags, but might result in not being able to find attributes if they're looked up by their name as definined in the XML (e.g bossID will return nil, so use bossid instead.)

docs.title: table GetEntityByTypeVarSub ( EntityType Type, int Variant = 0 , int SubType = 0, boolean Strict = false)
docs.text:
Returns a table containing the attributes of the entity on entities2.xml that match the given type and/or variant and/or subtype. The strict parameter determines if it should only return a value when all 3 attributes(type, var and sub) match or return whatever matches the type and take the rest as maybes.

Table usage 
print("Monstro's BossID:", XMLData.GetEntityByTypeVarSub(20).bossid)
child nodes

Child nodes are returned as tables alongside the rest of the attributes. For example, if you want to access the samples of a sound entry, you can use soundentry.sample[1].

docs.title: table GetEntryById ( XMLNode NodeType, int Idx )
docs.text:
Returns a table containing the attributes of the corresponding xml, the matching NodeType(Ex: XMLNode.TRINKET returns trinket nodes from pocketitems.xml) and match the given unique id.

Table usage 
print("Sad Onion's description:", XMLData.GetEntryById(XMLNode.ITEM, 1).description)
child nodes

Child nodes are returned as tables alongside the rest of the attributes. For example, if you want to access the samples of a sound entry, you can use soundentry.sample[1].

id?

The Id usually matches the actual id of the node in question, with the exception of cases like the entities.xml where ids are not unique, on those cases, the id is the order of the node and wont correspond with the actual id. On the cases of XMLs without ids, its just the order again.

docs.title: table GetEntryByName ( XMLNode NodeType, string Name )
docs.text:
Returns a table containing the attributes of the corresponding xml, the matching NodeType (Ex: XMLNode.TRINKET returns trinket nodes from pocketitems.xml) and match the given name parameter.

Table usage 
print("Sad Onion's description:", XMLData.GetEntryByName(XMLNode.ITEM, "The Sad Onion").description)
child nodes

Child nodes are returned as tables alongside the rest of the attributes. For example, if you want to access the samples of a sound entry, you can use soundentry.sample[1].

docs.title: table GetEntryFromEntity ( Entity Entity, boolean AutoXMLPick = true, boolean Strict)
docs.text:
Returns a table containing the attributes of the provided entity. The AutoXMLPick parameter determines if only entities2.xml should be used or if it should pick the xml that matches the EntityType (Ex: items.xml for pedestal collectibles) . The strict parameter determines if it should only return a value when the type,variant and subtype attributes match or return whatever matches the type and take the rest as maybes.

Table usage 
print("Player's birthright:", XMLData.GetEntryFromEntity(Isaac.GetPlayer()).birthright)
child nodes

Child nodes are returned as tables alongside the rest of the attributes. For example, if you want to access the samples of a sound entry, you can use soundentry.sample[1].

docs.title: int GetNumEntries ( XMLNode NodeType)
docs.text: Returns the number of entries a given XMLNode structure has.

docs.title: Lua API Documentation for The Binding of Isaac - REPENTOGON
docs.text:
This documentation covers the additions and modifications made to the Lua API by REPENTOGON.

Happily serving:

  • over 800 new or improved functions
  • over 200 new callbacks
  • over 30 new rideable dragons
  • over 60 new enums

A list of non API related changes can be found in the "changes" tab!

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
We have two methods of installation: Automatic and Manual. We also have a Steam Workshop page that has a similar method to Manual.

If the installation is successful you should be able to notice multiple changes to the game, most notably you should see REPENTOGON version in the titlebar. Here is an example of a complete installation:

docs.title: Automatic
docs.text:
Info

Automatic instructions only work on Windows for now. A Linux version of the installer is being worked on, and for now it should work in Wine, but there's still extra setup on there for now.

Info

We'll make this more automatic in the future, bear with us.

docs.title: What you'll need
docs.text: • The REPENTOGON installer (click here to download)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Within Steam, navigate to The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth
  2. Click on the gear to the right of the screen, and click on it
  3. Click on Properties
    • This opens a new window.
  1. Navigate to Installed Files, then click Browse
    • This opens a new window.
  1. Copy the REPENTOGONUpdater.exe downloaded earlier to the folder that just opened.
  1. Run REPENTOGONUpdater.exe.
    • This opens a new window.
  2. Press Install.
    • Once the log at the bottom says Finished!, installation is done. If the log instead says anything about failing, the installation was unsuccessful. Try a different method.
Info

On Linux and Steam Deck, add WINEDLLOVERRIDES="dsound=n,b" %command% as a launch option for Isaac.

docs.title: What you'll need
docs.text: • The latest release of REPENTOGON (click here to download)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Within Steam, navigate to The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth
  2. Click on the gear to the right of the screen, and click on it
  3. Click on Properties
    • This opens a new window.
  1. Navigate to Installed Files, then click Browse
    • This opens a new window.
  1. Extract the contents of REPENTOGON.zip to the folder that just opened.
Info

On Linux and Steam Deck, add WINEDLLOVERRIDES="dsound=n,b" %command% as a launch option for Isaac.

docs.title: What you'll need
docs.text: • REPENTOGON from the Steam Workshop

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Within Steam, navigate to The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth
  2. Click on the gear to the right of the screen, and click on it
  3. Click on Properties
    • This opens a new window.
  1. Navigate to Installed Files, then click Browse
    • This opens a new window.

  1. Navigate to the mods folder, then REPENTOGON_3127536138.

  2. Extract the contents of REPENTOGON.zip to the game's folder.

Info

On Linux and Steam Deck, add WINEDLLOVERRIDES="dsound=n,b" %command% as a launch option for Isaac.

You can now unsubscribe from the mod on Steam, if you wish.
